content.description: Start on the good flake on the left side of the boulder. Traverse right on small crimps. When you have two gaston crimps, fire straight up and top out. May be soft for the grade, v8;)
content.location: Start on left side of the Pile ups boulder and traverse right

content.description:
Sit start, straddling the arete to the right (east) of the Angel Wings traverse problem. Use slopers and whatever feet you can find to climb straight up the arete, topping out on the slab above.

This is listed in Urban Rock on the Angel Wings boulder as “SDS” and is given a grade of V6.
content.location: Starts seated on the arete to the right of the Angel Wings traverse problem, on the northeast of the two Pile Ups boulders. This is well to the left of Quotations Marks and is not the face climb next to Quotation Marks. The sit start is mandatory.

content.protection: Pad and spotter, scramble off the back.
content.location: Obvious two pockets on the east face.

content.description: The crux is after the halfway point.  Landing gets a little worse at crux, but still pretty darn good.
content.location: South side (main side). Starts on the left side of the Pile Ups and follows the lip all the way to the right side.  Going only to the halfway point is 5.10 / v1

content.description:
Polished pull leads to a snatch for a sidepull, set up and then lunge for the big ledge (crux).

Video

here.
content.protection: Pad and spotter. Be careful the ground is very hard here, perhaps there's a rock just beneath the dirt.

content.description:
Crux is second move.  Good landing though.

Video

here.
content.location: Southside (main side). Left most direct route on Pile Ups.  Starts at large greasy hold (left hand) and goes straight up to the lip and tops out.

content.description:
Balance-y warmup or intro problem for the outdoor bouldering beginner. Short problem without much risk and a relatively safe landing.

Start with your feet on thin edges and hands on two of the many decent hand-holds. Work your feet up gradually and set up for the crux: standing up and grabbing the excellent rail near the top of the problem. From there the finish is more of the same.
content.protection: Pad and spotter for the new climber. None required for the intermediate to advanced boulderer.
content.location: The north side of Pile Ups, roughly the center of the boulder.

content.description:
Sit down start to Pile Lieback.

Video

here.

It might be called Angel Wings Arete.

Start on the 2 large flakes. Traverse right to the arete and deadpoint up to the crimp.

The movement is absolutely amazing and pretty difficult due to the slight overhang.

It bakes in the sun almost all day though so it is better saved for the morning or end of day.
content.location: Located on the boulder behind the main pile ups boulder.
